paper_abstract: The first open case of the Brown-Erdos-Sos conjecture is equivalent to the following: for every c > 0, there is a threshold n(0) such that if a quasigroup has order n >= n(0), then for every subset S of triples of the form (a, b, ab) with vertical bar S vertical bar >= cn(2), there is a seven-element subset of the quasigroup which spans at least four triples of S. In this paper we prove the conjecture for finite groups.
